title: The Cannondale Adventure Neo is a step-through electric city bike with front and rear suspension
content:
Cannondale adds to its ebike range with the Adventure Neo

Published: February 2, 2021 at 2:30 pm

Cannondale has launched the Adventure Neo electric city bike, with a step-through frame and everything you need for urban riding, cycling to work or getting out for a spin at the weekends. Cannondale claims it’s the most comfortable bike you’ll ever ride.

It comes in four spec levels with prices from £2,500 / €2,499 to £3,800 / €3,999, all powered by Bosch motor systems.

The top-spec Cannondale Adventure Neo 1 EQ gets a Bosch Performance Line Cruise mid-mounted motor and a removable 625Wh battery, for a quoted range of up to 160km/100 miles.

  • Best electric bike
  • Best electric hybrid bike

Other features on the top-spec model include a rear view radar below the rear light – a collaboration with Garmin using the same tech as in the Garmin Varia RTL 510.

The radar alerts you to vehicles approaching from behind and how far away they are via a beep and a display on the bar-mounted head unit.

The top three models all get front and rear bike lights and a carrier rack as standard, with the rear light built into the rack. 

The Neo 1 EQ and Neo 2 EQ (with EQ signifying “equipped”) also have a Garmin wheel sensor. First seen on the Treadwell hybrid bike, this transmits speed, distance and other stats to Cannondale’s smartphone app and also reminds you when your ebike needs a service.

Comfort comes in the form of an SR Suntour suspension fork for all bikes except the base model, with 63mm of travel and a lockout. At the rear, there’s a suspension seatpost – again on all except the lowest spec Adventure Neo 4.

As well as suspension, the Adventure Neo 3 EQ has a dropper seatpost, which Cannondale says makes getting on and off the bike easier.

There’s a single chainring Shimano drivetrain on all the bikes, with either 10-speed or 9-speed derailleur shifting and a built-in chain and chainring protector.

Other features include a kickstand and – on all but the base-level spec – mudguards. All are compatible with a bolted-on Abus rear wheel lock and come with a Bosch Purion bar-mounted display.

Each spec has a couple of colour options and Cannondale says availability will be from March 2021.

Cannondale Adventure Neo range

Cannondale Adventure Neo EQ 1

  • Frame: SmartForm C3 Alloy
  • Fork: SR Suntour Mobie A32, 63mm travel
  • Motor: Bosch Performance Line Cruise
  • Battery: Bosch PowerTube 625Wh
  • Drivetrain: Shimano Deore M4100 10-speed
  • Gearing: 38t chainset, 11-42t cassette
  • Brakes: Shimano MT400 hydraulic disc
  • Wheels: Cannondale 2 rims on Shimano hubs
  • Tyres: Schwalbe Hurricane Performance Addix, 27.5 x 2.25in
  • Seatpost: Cane Creek Thudbuster G4 suspension
  • Saddle: Cannondale Adventure Neo
  • Sizes: Small, large
  • Price: £3,800 / €3,999

Cannondale Adventure Neo EQ 2

  • Frame: SmartForm C3 Alloy
  • Fork: SR Suntour Mobie A32, 63mm travel
  • Motor: Bosch Active Line Plus
  • Battery: Bosch PowerTube 500Wh
  • Drivetrain: Shimano Alivio 9-speed
  • Gearing: 38t chainset, 11-36t cassette
  • Brakes: Shimano MT200 hydraulic disc
  • Wheels: Cannondale 2 rims on Shimano hubs
  • Tyres: Kenda Kwick Seven.5, 27.5 x 2.20in
  • Seatpost: Cane Creek Thudbuster G4 suspension
  • Saddle: Cannondale Adventure Neo
  • Sizes: Small, large
  • Price: £3,200 / €3,299

Cannondale Adventure Neo EQ 3

  • Frame: SmartForm C3 Alloy
  • Fork: SR Suntour Mobie A32, 63mm travel
  • Motor: Bosch Active Line Plus
  • Battery: Bosch PowerTube 400Wh
  • Drivetrain: Shimano Altus 9-speed
  • Gearing: 38t chainset, 11-36t cassette
  • Brakes: Tektro M275 hydraulic disc
  • Wheels: Cannondale 2 rims on Shimano hubs
  • Tyres: Kenda Kwick Seven.5, 27.5 x 2.20in
  • Seatpost: TranzX suspension dropper post, 50mm travel
  • Saddle: Cannondale Ergo Comfort
  • Sizes: Small, large
  • Price: £2,800 / €2,799

Cannondale Adventure Neo 4

  • Frame: SmartForm C3 Alloy
  • Fork: SmartForm C3 Alloy
  • Motor: Bosch Active Line
  • Battery: Bosch PowerTube 400Wh
  • Drivetrain: Shimano Altus 9-speed
  • Gearing: 38t chainset, 11-36t cassette
  • Brakes: Tektro M275 hydraulic disc
  • Wheels: Cannondale 2 rims on Shimano hubs
  • Tyres: Kenda Kwick Seven.5, 27.5 x 2.20″
  • Seatpost: Cannondale 4, alloy
  • Saddle: Cannondale Ergo Comfort
  • Sizes: Small, large
  • Price: £2,500 / €2,499

Authors

Paul has been riding since he was a teenager and has been writing about bike tech for almost five years. He was into gravel before it was even invented, riding a cyclocross bike across the South Downs and along muddy paths through the Chilterns. He dabbled in cross-country mountain biking too, before returning to drop bar bikes.
author: Paul Norman
